item.title: American Addiction Centers Data Breach Impacts 422,000 People
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
American Addiction Centers says the personal information of more than 422,000 people was stolen in a data breach.

The post American Addiction Centers Data Breach Impacts 422,000 People appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Industry Moves for the week of December 23, 2024 - SecurityWeek
item.description: Explore industry moves and significant changes in the industry for the week of December 23, 2024. Stay updated with the latest industry trends and shifts.

item.title: 2025 NDAA Provides $3 Billion Funding for FCC’s Rip-and-Replace Program
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
The 2025 National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA) has been signed into law and it authorizes several cyber-related initiatives. 

The post 2025 NDAA Provides $3 Billion Funding for FCC’s Rip-and-Replace Program appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Adobe Patches ColdFusion Flaw at High Risk of Exploitation
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Adobe has released patches for a high-severity ColdFusion vulnerability for which proof-of-concept (PoC) code exists.

The post Adobe Patches ColdFusion Flaw at High Risk of Exploitation appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Beware Of Shadow AI – Shadow IT’s Less Well-Known Brother
item.dc:creator: Etay Maor
item.description:
While AI tools can enable employees to be innovative and productive, significant data privacy risks can stem from their usage.

The post Beware Of Shadow AI – Shadow IT’s Less Well-Known Brother appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: 5.6 Million Impacted by Ransomware Attack on Healthcare Giant Ascension
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Ascension Health says the personal, medical, and payment information of 5.6 million people was stolen in a May 2024 ransomware attack.

The post 5.6 Million Impacted by Ransomware Attack on Healthcare Giant Ascension appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Sophos Patches Critical Firewall Vulnerabilities
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Sophos has released patches for a critical-severity firewall vulnerability that could lead to remote code execution.

The post Sophos Patches Critical Firewall Vulnerabilities appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: LockBit Ransomware Developer Arrested in Israel at Request of US
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Dual Russian and Israeli national has been arrested in Israel and will be extradited to the US to face charges related to LockBit ransomware development.

The post LockBit Ransomware Developer Arrested in Israel at Request of US appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Italy’s Privacy Watchdog Fines OpenAI for ChatGPT’s Violations in Collecting Users Personal Data
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description:
Italy’s data protection watchdog fined OpenAI 15 million euros ($15.6 million) after wrapping up a probe into collection of personal data.

The post Italy’s Privacy Watchdog Fines OpenAI for ChatGPT’s Violations in Collecting Users Personal Data appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Apple Complains Meta Requests Risk Privacy in Spat Over EU Efforts to Widen Access to iPhone Tech
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description:
Apple complained that requests from Meta Platforms for access to its operating software threaten user privacy, in a spat fueled by the European Union’s intensifying efforts to get the iPhone maker to open up to products from tech rivals.

The post Apple Complains Meta Requests Risk Privacy in Spat Over EU Efforts to Widen Access to iPhone Tech appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: In Other News: McDonald’s API Hacking, Netflix Fine, Malware Kills ICS Process
item.dc:creator: SecurityWeek News
item.description:
Noteworthy stories that might have slipped under the radar: McDonald’s API hacking, Netflix fined nearly $5 million in Netherlands, experimental malware killing ICS process. 

The post In Other News: McDonald’s API Hacking, Netflix Fine, Malware Kills ICS Process   appeared first on SecurityWeek.
